The goal of this project is to strengthen the capacity of India’s Department of AIDS Control (DAC), and affiliated organizations, to own, enhance and sustain the HIV/AIDS epidemic response. It aligns closely with PEPFAR India’s Five-Year Country Strategy, particularly Goal #4, Health Systems Strengthening, as well as the following PEPFAR Blueprint Road Maps: Saving Lives, Smart Investments and Driving Results with Science.
The geographic coverage of the lab strengthening project is national in scope, including 13 National Reference Laboratories (NRLs), 117 State Reference Laboratories (SRLs), other HIV related laboratories and approximately 12,900 Integrated Counseling and Testing Centers (ICTCs) located across 28 states and seven union territories. The mechanism will leverage government resources to demonstrate innovative approaches for improving the quality of lab services. Regional Technical Specialists (RTSs), who mentor and provide onsite technical assistance (TA) to laboratories, will be placed in decentralized locations, closer to these laboratories as opposed to a project office. This will reduce travel costs and optimize laboratory contact time. Workshops/trainings will be planned regionally to ensure maximum participation of staff from peripheral labs, also reducing logistics and opportunity costs.
The primary focus of the project is to provide TA leading to improved adherence to quality standards of laboratory services and achievement of accreditation status. The TA will be expanded to labs beyond HIV testing, that is, STI and reproductive tract infection (RTI), EID, VL and CD4 testing laboratories. Along with the expansion of TA, transition activities will be planned in alignment with the National AIDS Control Program (NACP) Phase IV.
